Reviews.Title: “Prime location, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: EriClaud54
Reviews.Content: The location is great because it's close to many of the prime sites, but it's too noisy to sleep. Aside from the shouting and 3am cat calls, there were a couple of other issues. Our air conditioner didn't work, plus we were in a smoking room. The room and bathroom were much bigger than average and the staff was helpful and friendly. Some of the restaurant recommendations were a little off (hours weren't specified, directions weren't clear, food wasn't the style that was specified), so be specific with what you want or need.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: Peter T
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is absolutely amazing! You are in the centre of the Old Rome, it means all landmarks are as close as they just can be. Rooms are spacious, really nice antique style furnished. Breakfast is delicious, everyone will find his favourite kind of meal. Staff are really friendly and helpfull every time you need them. They will tell you which landmarks you should visit, how to get there, where to find a good meal etc. This hotel was absolutely marvelous!

Reviews.Title: “Central Rome Visit”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Traveller65
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right around the corner from the piazza in front of the Pantheon. The entrance is small but don't let that fool you as the room was very large by European standards and the common rooms were more than adequate. The staff was very friendly and most helpful in pointing us to various sites in central Rome. The room was very clean and well designed for both pleasure and business trips. They even had a power outlet for my laptop and free wireless access through a secured server. We really enjoyed our four days as this hotel is perfectly situated for tourists who enjoy walking to to everything in central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveller010
Reviews.Content: The hotel and it's rooms and services were exactly as desribed on their website. I booked this hotel for location and price but was very very pleasantly surprised. We were fortunate to get an upgraded room (very large) that included a king bed and full-size bathroom with large soaker tub. The bed is firm - as with all European beds but we prefer firm over soft. Our room was on the street side and could be considered noisy for some but we enjoyed listening to the pedestrian traffic and closing the wood shutters and or windows elimanted all noise. All front desk were very very professional and appeared to take pride in their job. They all recommended excellent restaurants meeting our different needs each night and none of those were the sidewalk cafes that are usually overpriced. The cleaning staff also waited to clean our room based on our sleep patterns as we managed the jet lag. We utilized the car service the hotel arranged from the airport and the car was great - driver waiting for us at the airport with our name on card and provided a full-size BMW. I would recommend this property to anyone staying in Rome for both location (10 steps outside the door and you're facing the Pantheon in all its splendor) and the hotel including its service and facilities was great.

Reviews.Title: “should have more than 5 to rate it”
Reviews.Author: astalava
Reviews.Content: this hotel has everything you want in one place. It's a minute from the Pantheon, have superb rooms and the greatest helpful staff you can ask for! The price is fair compare to other places I checked. price includes tasty breakfast too. We sure coming back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mparr27
Reviews.Content: You can walk to all the attractions/great restaurants in the street opposute - will return

Reviews.Title: “Great for your Roman Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Dman_DW
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel in a perfect location. The staff is fantastic (special thanks to Roberto-the Head Receptionist, Teresa, Roberto, Marco, Giovanni-the chef, and Francesco-the driver) and eager to help. Thanks to their advice you will save a lot of time and money. There are many great restaurants around the hotel and two grocery stores nearby. The morning breakfast is plentiful and includes great cold cuts, fresh breads, fruit and yogurt, or if you like eggs and bacon cooked to order. It is an 18th century building, with charming little rooms, private bathrooms, and wooden ceilings. The rooms are very small but extremely comfortable and beautifully appointed. The location couldn’t be any better – 2km walking distance to all top historic sites – the Vatican, the Colosseum, the Spanish Steps, the Baths of Diocletian, etc… Located next to the Pantheon, just a few minutes from Piazza Navona, and by some of the greatest baroque churches in Rome – it gives any tourist a perfect base to explore from. The official website with all its pictures is very true to the actual offerings. If you are taking an early flight out – ask about the private shuttle service. The hotel driver, Giovanni will take you to the airport in his Mercedes van for about 60-75 Euros. The vehicular access to the hotel is restricted during the day, so you may have to walk a block with your bags, if you are arriving during the day. At night/very early morning (we left at 3:30am to catch a flight at 6am), however, the hotel driver will come up right to the front door. I highly recommend this place, if you are looking for a truly Roman Holiday!

Reviews.Title: “great location, just average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Whitney D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Pantheon November 2011 for our Anniversary trip. The staff is very friendly and answered questions we had. The location is what makes this hotel worth it. It is directly next to the pantheon and in the middle of the city. We were able to walk to every site (20-25 walk to Vatican, 20 min walk to coliseum, everything else within 20 min walk). If you are looking for the perfectly placed hotel and want a decent deal (we got a good deal b/c it was the off season) then this hotel would work. If you are looking for something a little more luxurious then I would look elsewhere. The room itself seemed a little dirty b/c it was old. The bathroom was updated and very clean and nice. Our room was extremely small (even small for European standards). Breakfast is included from 7-10am. They do offer a car service to/from the airport for 60 euros - more expensive then a taxi but it was nice to know the car would be there waiting for us when we arrived. We were picked up in a very nice mercedes but I do not think our driver spoke english. They will email you a couple weeks before your trip to ask you if you would like this service. We arrived around 9am not expecting our room to be ready but to our surprised it was! It could have been because we got the car service and they were aware of our early arrival, but it was definitely a nice surprise to be able to get into our room that early. Check out is noon. The internet didnt work in our room - we had to use it in the bar area - not a huge deal but it would have been nice to be able to quickly check internet in our own room. They offer 10 hours of internet for free - which is plently. They told us if we used it all up they would give us another password for another 10 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lodesman
Reviews.Content: November is a favourite time for us in Rome, the temperature 12-15C and blue skies allow for great walks. The Pantheon Hotel is centrally located and the rooms are well furnished, the staff could not have been more helpful or friendly. Excellent breakfast room in the basement with a good range of food. Bedrooms are small but very comfortable (after all it is a city centre hotel in Rome) and the bathrooms excellently furnished. Cheerful little bar in/above the lounge where there is WiFi (only there and not in the rooms). Personally I cannot recommend it highly enough and we will be back there yet again (Rome is one of our favourite cities).

Reviews.Title: “Right location, right room, right price”
Reviews.Author: Sybil101
Reviews.Content: Our original plans for accommodation in Rome fell through at the last minute during our recent eight-day visit. Attracted by its charming lobby, we walked into the Hotel Pantheon, located just a few hundred feet from the Pantheon itself, and were offered a quiet room at the back (as we requested) at an outstanding rate given that it is a four-star hotel - 150 euros a night, or roughly half the usual rate. I start with the price because we couldn't have gotten better value for money. We liked almost everything about the Hotel. It is very small and intimate, around 15 rooms in carved out of a centuries-old building. Restored relatively recently, it is beautifully, tastefully, and expensively decorated. The staff is very helpful and friendly; I single out Roberto perhaps because we happened to see him more than the others at the front desk, but everyone was extemely pleasant, creating a family-like environment. The breakfast was ample, although we preferred going to the famed Tazza d'Oro caffe' across the street from the Hotel. If we could get the same price again, we wouldn't hesitate to return, year after year (since Rome is our favorite city in the world). This said, and the reason I rate it as Very Good rather than Excellent: the Hotel is a bit quirky if you compare it to other four-star hotels in the area (for example, the Hotel Minerva or Albergo del Sole). I'm only pointing out these slight "quirks" because people looking for a four-star hotel, and willing to pay full price, may want to know. I'll start with service: Because of the small size, the front desk is staffed by just one person, which occasionally means there are lines for help. We didn't mind at all, but if you're paying 300-400 euros a night, you might. Also perhaps because of the small staff, there always seemed to be cleaning equipment and bags of laundry in the hallway. As for the room: ours was very small, as was the bath, and the latter had some of the usual oddities: awkwardly placed fixtures, etc.. The charming little balcony looked into a lightwell, which sounds worse than it was: I love Rome, and don't mind seeing the neighbors' balconies, service areas, etc., but someone paying 300-400 euros might. (The great advantage to our room was that it was absolutely quiet except for some very noisy pigeons.) Because our room wasn't ready the first night, we were given a junior suite at the same rate: it was lovely, spacious, right up under the eaves, quiet (but no windows: light came in from skylights) and would have been available to us for half-price, at 200 euros, if we had been able to afford that for eight days. One last comment: the lobby and hallways often smelled of cigarette smoke, in part because the staff smoked. Even though they would take their smoke breaks outside the Hotel's front door, the smoke wafted back into the lobby and up the stairwell: again, this detracts slightly from the quality of the hotel and is not what one would expect of a "four star" establishment which in other ways was immaculately maintained. To sum up: the Hotel Pantheon was perfect for us in every respect, we would go back in a heartbeat if we could get the same room and same rate, but someone able to pay full price for a four-star hotel should consider carefully what he/she expects.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff until billing”
Reviews.Author: Wade C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Pantheon for a week in April for our honeymoon. After a lot of review reading both here and in guidebooks, we settled on it and were not disappointed. The location is perfection, as many have said. It's great to walk about 30 seconds to a great view of the Pantheon (one of my favorite sites in Rome). It's also great for seeing anything in Rome, as the Pantheon is pretty central and most things are in easy walking distance for those who don't mind a stroll; we avoided vehicles the entire time and none of our walks to sites (the forum, the Vatican, the Villa Borghese, etc.) seemed too tiresome. Most of the things people want to see is within a few miles. The room was fine. It was not a luxury suite, but we knew not to expect such a thing. It was a fine room with exposed wooden beams (which I found aesthetically pleasant), a decent bed (we had no trouble sleeping), a GREAT bathroom, a safe for valuables and a window opening onto the street that could be opened or closed depending on noise and temperature. Incidentally, noise can go until the wee hours and start very early, but sometimes this can be a pleasant surprise - we had a lovely solo guitar play us to sleep one night as if in a private concert. It's less pleasant to hear the start of the business day when you're trying to sleep in a bit, but it's a crowded city, so what can you expect? There was no view except of the building across the narrow street, but we didn't come to Rome to look out our hotel window. My wife and I both thought breakfast was actually great. In Italy I expected a less generous spread; there were cereals, breads, pastries, meats, cheeses, fruits, yogurts, and even eggs were available to order if desired (I can't say how they were prepared, as we did not try them). The nicest part was having someone take a coffee order for us; it was great to start the day with a cappuccino. I don't know what anyone has to complain about; we always got a table even though the hotel was full, and we always went out feeling like we'd had a good breakfast. The front desk staff was great to work with... up to a point. All of our needs were met, and the staff were very helpful with any concerns we had while we were staying there. They also arranged transport from and to the airport (for an extra fee, but worth it for me; I did not want to deal with the hassle of a taxi the week before Easter after a long flight), and the drivers both ways proved capable and helpful. The problem came after I returned to the USA and found that they had in fact billed my credit card twice for the stay. I got in touch via email and was told that they needed specific information about my bank (rather than refunding to my credit card account), so I sent what they asked for and was told they would be in touch when they had worked out a refund with my bank. It has been about seven months and no reimbursement has come, nor has any communication from the hotel. I have emailed about it again, but have not gotten a reply. This reluctance to rectify a billing issue tells me two things. The first of these is that the hotel staff can be careless with the billing, which is not reassuring (a week-long stay just before Easter, while not bank-breaking, was by no means cheap), but I can understand and sympathize; we're all human, we all make mistakes. But the second and more serious message to take from my experience is that, after being alerted to a customer service problem - a problem, in fact, caused by hotel staff, not a guest - the staff gave me assurance of resolution but failed to follow through. This is not the way to treat a customer in a service industry. It is with regret that I have to rate this hotel less than five stars, which I certainly would have given it if not for the unfortunate billing situation. I have given up hope of satisfactory resolution. The bottom line of my review: the hotel is great, the staff is friendly, and the location is fantastic, but if you stay here, be extremely careful about your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and that's about it”
Reviews.Author: newsak
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Pantheon for 4 nights recently and were quite surprised by the accommodations (or lack thereof), particularly given all the positive reviews on TA. The location is centrally located and we would definitely stay in the area again, but will be choosing a different hotel. Where to begin...the bed was like sleeping on the ground it was so hard. The bed spread looked like it had been there since the building was originally built. While the website states that all rooms have tubs, not so, as ours had a shower pan in which we had to carefully monitor the amount of water used because the drain was not working properly. It was SO noisy into the wee morning hours from the tourists in the restaurants below which we could hear but could not see; our view was of the tile roof. The breakfast left a lot to be desired and we only ate there one time. On a positive note, the staff is helpful and arranged for a driver to pick us up from the airport and drive us back at 60 euro each way. (While there is a cab stand nearby, not all are honest, and it's better to do it through the hotel, even if it's above the advertised rate to FCO.) Overall, a very expensive hotel ($400 per night) for what you get. We stayed in room 302 for reference.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in the Midst of the City”
Reviews.Author: LuluDan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the last night of our month in Italy at this lovely hotel in Rome. In spite of its being within one block of the Pantheon, one of the busiest attractions in Rome, it was a lovely, gracious and quiet place to stay. The convenience to all the historic sites was perfect and the assistance with tickets, etc. from the staff was excellent. I would return to this lovely, small hotel with its aura of privacy, and personal attention on our next stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Nell B
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. If you're used to big chain hotel rooms with massive marshmallow beds you might initially be disappointed, but I urge you to stick it out. When I walked into the room (101) even I thought it might be too small and dark, but it turned out to be wonderful, with high ceilings and a window that opened onto a lively street. Plus the bathroom was recently renovated and huge and luxurious. There was air conditioning and it turned out to be very well lit. The staff of the hotel, particularly Teresa and Roberto, were gracious and helpful and went out of their way to make us happy. The place was romantic and charming and wonderful and the location can't be beat. Steps (literally steps: like 15 of them) from the hotel is the Pantheon and you are central to everything you want to see. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Around the corner from the Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: bestkeptsecret31187
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 4 days at the Pantheon Hotel.It was a very small hotel but I guess most are in Rome. They were very helpful with directions, and even getting a driver for us to the airport.There were only 13 rooms and I guess they are all different.We had a large room,but our friends had a very small room. The rooms were very dark with wood paneling and the lighting was very dark.The bathrooms were beautiful and very bright.Breakfast was included in the price of the room.The food was ok, nothing special.I don't think I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location...Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Carol T
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect and the hotel is truly a boutique hotel. The staff was warm and friendly. The rooms were small but we didn't go to Rome to sit in a hotel room. The only reason I did not rate this 5 stars is that they recommended the Florence trip on Green line that was horrendous....hopefully they will review tours they recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only thing good here..”
Reviews.Author: chicagola
Reviews.Content: I have gone between rating this a 2 or a 3....primarily on location which is amazing. This place is really more like a b&b...small, outdated. We were upgraded to the junior suite which is like the room in your aunt's attic....sloping wood ceiling with no windows other than a skylight in the ceiling which was covered with a curtain. The room was so dark I could hardly see at night. The soft goods are old and outdated. The bathrooms have been recently redone which helped although we had NO counter space at all so we were forced to use the desk for our toiletries and to do make-up - in the dark. Breakfast was average at best - tiny room in the basement. Hard to believe this place cost about the same thing as our huge rooms with balconies and views of the Mediterranea on the coast but I guess it's the way things are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pantheon staff gets 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Randy B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent a week at Hotel Pantheon in September 2011. While the location is spectacular, and the rooms are clean, the staff at the hotel was even better. Many kudos to Theresa, who made our visit fun, informative, and a pleasure. She sent us to our favorite restaurant right around the corner, La Sagrestia, and we ended up dining there frequently. Sure, the rooms are small, the closet space basically nonexistent, prices too high...........blah, blah, blah. If you choose to stay in a certain area, you pay the price. The free breakfast downstairs was great every morning, and the lobby is beautiful. WiFi didn't work the first few days, but Theresa and Roberto gladly offered us the PC in the office any time we wanted. All in all, thank you, Theresa and Roberto, for making our trip so fun.

Reviews.Title: “good location--nothing else”
Reviews.Author: bobeuritt
Reviews.Content: perfect location, rooms were like bein g in a cave. its tired and dreary

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: justinnessa
Reviews.Content: The reviews about this place are true. The location could not be better. You literally walk around the corner and are greeted by the jaw-dropping Pantheon. A previous reviewer said the Pantheon was a few minutes’ walk from the hotel which is not accurate. It is literally 100 feet from the hotel. There are a bunch of restaurants, coffee shops, bars, souvenir shops, everywhere. It's within walking distance to the Coliseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, and Campo di Fiorna. The staff was friendly and very helpful with restaurant reservations. We received a welcome drink on arrival and they held our luggage until we could check in. The Wi-Fi in the building was spotty, but was free, which was a nice addition. The rooms were very clean and the cleaning staff was friendly and accommodating. They always stocked the fridge and left extra towels and soap when requested. The only drawback to this hotel would be that the beds were EXTREMELY hard. My husband and I are in our early 30's and woke up every morning quite stiff. That being said, the location, exceptional service, and cleanliness of the hotel beyond made up for that. PS: There is no fitness center. I'm not sure how to delete that from my rating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Great Value, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: MD_Melb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Pantheon in July, 2011. We stayed there 3 nights. It was a very busy time of the year and there was lots happening around the Pantheon. We were in the perfect location to take advantage of the location as the Pantheon is a few minutes from the Hotel. Our room was great (couldn't fault it actually)! The room opened out onto the street (we were on the first level) but we didn't find it noisy at all. We arrived at around 8.30am and Roberto on the front desk was very happy to store our luggage and allowed us to check in a little earlier which was appreciated. They were just as reasonable when it was time to go as we left our luggage at the hotel (nice and safe) and then came back to collect it in the afternoon and organised a taxi come and pick us up for our flight. The breakfast was quirky but in line with what is offered in European hotels,i.e. salami, cheese, cereals, pastries, fruit, toast, yogurt, juices and wonderful coffee. (An authentic cappuccino greeted us each morning and if we wanted another one ... the staff would be more than happy to provide.) Plenty of food on offer. Roberto on the front desk was very helpful when we asked for suggestions on where to dine and how to find places. He had excellent English. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. (We met a family with three children and they seemed to be enjoying their larger room as well.)

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: StevenandBec
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights when we first arrived in Rome. It is in a fantastic location, literally meters from the Pantheon, very close to Piazza Navona, the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps and within walking distance to all other major sights within Rome. We arrived early in the day due to our flight arriving in the morning, however our room was available immediately for us which was fantastic. The staff were very helpful. When we requested an iron it was there almost immediately. The room was small (as most rooms in Rome are), but the bed was comfortable, the room was quiet and the bathroom was very nice. We enjoyed our stay here and have already recommended it to family.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect location to stay in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: 35805Anna
Reviews.Content: We had a marvelous time during our 3 night stay! The staff was wonderful and extremely helpful during our stay. The breakfast was perfect in size, with hot and cold items,and lovely espresso and cappuccino, or coffee to order. Myself, my husband and our two small children and a very close family friend shared a lovely room, which had a tub (great for kids after a long day of sight seeing!!) The beds were comfortable, the room was clean and has a charm about it. The Pantheon is literally right around the corner and all the other important sights;The Spanish Steps, The Trevi fountain are in very close proximity. The neighborhood is lovely and you literally can step out of the hotel to awesome restaurants. We would stay there again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: frequentflier23
Reviews.Content: Loved the location right by the Pantheon and in the thick of things. Only stayed a night, but found it to be clean and comfortable with a nice breakfast room downstairs. We asked for a quiet room and had one that didn't overlook the street, so that worked well for us. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: SuePT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small and historic with the friendliest of staff. Breakfast is included and is a very decent buffet with a cook to order breakfast for those who like eggs and bacon. We stayed in the family room with a King size bed and 2 singles with a large bathroom. It is under the eaves and very quiet. For Rome, the price was reasonable E534 for 3 nights for the double room. There is a lift to help with luggage and cocktail hour from 5:30 - 7 with a free drink. The absolute best part is the location; at the opening of the Pantheon Plaza. The street is pedestrianized with lots of small restaurants in the decent price range. The Trevi fountain is a short walk away and the whole area is charming.

Reviews.Title: “No better location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: sandra7979
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Pantheon for our 3 night stay in Rome after reviewing several positive reviews on Trip Advisor and were very pleased with our decision. The location of the hotel was perfect, with a less than 20 second walk to the Pantheon. Being centrally located, we were easily able to access the Vatican, Trevi Fountain, and Colosseum by foot in 20 minutes or less. The hotel staff was extremely friendly, helpful, and accommodating. Upon check-in, we were offered welcome drinks in the hotel bar, provided a personal password for wifi access, and provided a detailed map of the city. We found the rooms to be very comfortable and clean. The bathrooms were recently renovated and very spacious. The breakfast provided each morning was tasty and included several options. If we return to Rome again one day, we would most definitely consider Hotel Pantheon again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay, especially for first-time visitors to Rome”
Reviews.Author: londonlover58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Pantheon for our first trip to Rome in July 2011. The hotel has all the charm of a B&B, with a great location right next to the Pantheon. Great area for shopping and restaurants. The hotel staff was especially helpful, with great restaurant recommendations. The only negative I can mention is that there were no English language stations available on TV, but that is a minor negative. Overall, the experience was great, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: imbrown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend and his family for around 3 nights in April. The hotel is in the most perfect location to explore all Rome has to offer. The Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Coliseum and Rome's famous shopping street, Via del Corso are all within walking distance. The Pantheon itself really is 'just around the corner' and is buzzing both night and day, boutique shops, delish restaurants, live music as soon as you step out the door. The hotel staff were very friendly and we were upgraded to a family size room which was really big with 2 lovely bathrooms. Don't miss out on "Il Gelato di San Crispino" near the Trevi Fountain, the ice cream is to die for! We had a fabulous time here and I would LOVE to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: fgh8664
Reviews.Content: After reviewing many different hotels in Rome on Trip Advisor, we picked the Hotel Pantheon based on it's great reviews and it's location. We hit a home run on both accounts! Just around the corner from the Pantheon itself, the hotel is a real gem at a reasonable price for Rome standards. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We arrived a bit early, so they gladly secured our luggage so that we could get started with our tour of the city. When we returned later in the afternoon, our luggage had already been taken up to our room. The room was small but very, very nice. The bed was comfortable, the a/c was a treat and the bathroom was quite big. The tub/shower was awesome, the largest we had during our entire trip. Breakfast was excellent and included a nice spread of breads, pastries, eggs, yogurts, fresh fruit and assorted meats and cheeses. Cappuccino was prepared to order and was just as good as the 4 euro cup offered on the street. The WI-FI connection and service was the only disappointment that we encountered. Be sure to take note of the hotel's location which is central to just about all of the major sights in Rome. Everything was within walking distance. The surrounding area is full of outdoor cafes, bistros, various shops and bars. The hotel will arrange a car service to the airport for 55 euro, which we used and found to be reliable and efficient. We will definitely stay at the Hotel Pantheon during our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Darcy'smom
Reviews.Content: My husband, 12 year old son and I stayed at the Hotel Pantheon for 4 nights. We shared a room, but the rollaway bed they brought in for my son was quite comfortable and the room was large enough to accomodate us all. The room itself was nothing special, although it was clean and large for Rome. The bed was a little too firm, and there wasn't enough space to really unpack, but these were minor drawbacks. The bathroom was quite nice and had clearly been recently redone, and was also spotless. It had a very nice, large shower and tub. Breakfast at the hotel was good, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. However, what makes this hotel special is the location. It is literally steps from the Pantheon, and within 15 minutes walking distance to everything else -- the Coliseum, Vatican, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain -- everything. It is also near shops and restaurants. I would definitely stay again if visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: theorchidlady
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. First, as every other review noted, Roberto, the main front desk officer was fantasticly helpful. From our initial email communications and reservations to our stay, Roberto was always able to meet our needs. The location of the hotel was fabulous! It was right in the center of everything and was only steps away from a huge number of major tourist sites as well as locations for super dinners and night life. Downtown Rome is a happening place in the evenings and the hotel is in the thick of it. The rooms themselves were quite nice, if a bit dark. They only use low wattage bulbs. The free breakfast was also extensive and good, though the basement room where it is served does get a bit hot. The rooms are cooled by air conditioners by the window and unfortunately when you pull the curtains to keep out light, you block the AC's ability to cool the room. This could be easily corrected by shortening the curtains, but they have not done so yet. The bathrooms are very modern and clean. The rooms have lovely old wooden beams in the ceiling. The hotel itself is quite small, only about 10 rooms or so, and quite intimate. Given its size, it is surprising and quite a commendation to the staff, that it has such a good reputation on international web sites. I reserved our rooms 6 months out and given the hotel's size, I recommend that reservations be made early.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley loved it, wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: KellyGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Just back from an amazing 3 day trip to Rome. Made amazing, in part, by the Pantheon Hotel. I was there celebrating my 30th Birthday with my Fiance, my best friend and her husband. When we arrived we were given an automatic upgrade to a suite which was just beautiful. The staff at the hotel, Roberto, Teresa, and another gentleman (sorry I didn't note your name!) were fantastic, their restaurant recommendations were spot on and they couldn't have been more helpful. The location of the hotel is phenomenal! It looks close to the Pantheon on the map, but until you see it you don't appreciate just how close it is! It is literally round the corner from the hotel, amazing to finish your evening after a lovely meal to go and sit outside in a restaurant in the Pantheon square with a drink marvelling at the sheer size of it while soaking up the atmosphere, then wander the few steps back to the hotel when it's time for bed, it is like a movie set! The hotel itself is lovely inside and very comfortable. I would also recommend taking the hotels airport transfer option. Thank you to the Hotel Pantheon for helping to make my birthday so special!

Reviews.Title: “Lifesaver!”
Reviews.Author: Bayjb
Reviews.Content: I didn't start my time in Rome at the Hotel Pantheon but I'm so glad I stumbled upon it. I was staying at another hotel and having an awful experience. I was looking to relocate ASAP and found this while sightseeing. I went in, exhausted and sad, asking if they had any single rooms available and within minutes I was shown a room on the second floor that was open. And after seeing it, I booked it right away and went back to my old hotel to get out of there. The single room is small but it had a huge bed, nice fixtures and a VERY nice bathroom. Apparently, the bathrooms were recently remodeled and it showed. It had a huge tub, nice rain shower and a huge sink for my stuff. The closet was also good size and overall, the room was in really great shape. Sure, there wasn't a lot of walking room because the bed took up most of it but it wasn't awful. Given its location, it could be loud, especially if you face the street, but mine didn't and despite some odd noises from the alley behind my room, it was quiet, which was PERFECT at the end of the day. My only quibbles were that the TV didn't work (which I only wanted at night before bed) and the wifi quality was spotty. The location is really perfect for Central Rome and an easy walk to the Pantheon, Vittoro Emanualle Monument and the Vatican. I walked there from the hotel and it took me 15 minutes. Easy. The staff was really helpful and nice as well. They helped me make dinner reservations, call taxis and provide answers I had to things in the area. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: irishindependent
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Hotel Pantheon in mid March with my husband. Took a chance on it based on the tripadvisor reviews as it was a number of years since we had been to Rome. The room was not cheap(€180 per night B&B) and the breakfast, while adequate, was not 4 star quality. In fact, the hotel is really a three star standard property. BUT the room was lovely, the staff exceptionally helpful and friendly and the location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: jmr0404
Reviews.Content: You can not find a better location in Rome to stay. You are a few steps away from the Pantheon and very close to many of the best piazzas in Rome. The hotel staff service was excellent - great restaurant recommendations, answered all of our questions perfectly, arranged transportation from airport and to train station flawlessly. The neighborhood around the hotel was perfect for walks / cafe / wine bars. My compliments to the hotel staff...you helped to make our stay in Rome fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: qlder_03
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location-close to all of the major sights. The staff were very friendly and helpful. A great breakfast was included. We stayed over the New Year period which was peak period and it was a bit noisy on New Year's Eve but that is to be expected in Rome. The room was strangely laid out, as you came into the room, hung your jackets then climbed stairs to the bed/bathroom. Free WiFi is offered but I found it kept dropping out unless I sat in a particular location. Excellent bathroom facilities. A word of warning for future travellers-at the train station if you are getting a taxi DO NOT get in if they offer a flat fare! We asked several drivers and they all said 38Euros to the hotel. Turns out it should have only been about 15-20Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cherb1733
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pantheon is located on a charming cobblestone street in the heart of old Rome. It is right around the corner from the Pantheon. It is a boutique hotel, with wood ceilings and nice atmosphere. What I love about this location is the fact that there are very few cars because of the narrowness of the medeivel streets. It is mostly a pedestrian area, with no major boulevards. There are tons of restaurants, shops, and historical points of interest right out the front door. We could walk to every tourist attraction, 5 minutes to Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona, 30 seconds to Pantheon, 15 minutes to Roman Forum and colisseum, the locations was very central. We could easily walk to Trasteverde for dinner. The hotel itself has a nice lobby and breakfast room, and the rooms are large and nicely decorated. The only fault is that there is no view from the windows really, and no rooftop deck. However the location is unbeatable, the rooms very nicely decorated and spacious, and if you want to be outside you simply walk out the front door and sit at one of the many cafes around the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Suberb stay”
Reviews.Author: jpriest1966
Reviews.Content: Went for a long weekend just before Christmas and cannot recommend this highly enough. Spacious, clean and well appointed with helpful staff this is an excellent hotel in a superb spot just next to the Pantheon but also well placed for all the key sites in central Rome

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! There is NO OTHER place in Rome better than here!”
Reviews.Author: SotoandMata
Reviews.Content: I just returned after a three night trip to Rome. After much research, we settled on Hotel Pantheon. Initially, I was a bit worried because the reviews were not overwhelmingly positive but we booked anyway since the price and location were great. However, upon actually arriving at the hotel, we were unbelieveably surprised! First of all, the hotel is LITERALLY FOOTSTEPS from the Pantheon. Maybe a 20 second walk. The Piazza de la Rotonda is full of life at all times of the day. In fact, in the evenings, we would typically walk right out of the hotel to go to the Piazza for a light evening drink and to just watch the people. The location was outright AMAZING. Our friends stayed at a five-star hotel on Via de Giulia and were a little bit away from the center of the center of Rome. We were right there--great restaurants, nightlife, shopping EVERYTHING. Piazza Navona is a 3 minute walk, Fontana de Trevi is about 6 min. walk and Collessum is about 12-15 min. All is within walking distance, even the Vatican (but it was raining so we took a cab which cost us 6 euro, great price. Anyway, enough about the Pantheon, we all know it's great. Back to the hotel! The rooms were quite spacious given Rome standards. My husband and I are both very tall and "big boned" as we like to say, so we were able to walk about freely throughout the room and had spaced to our two large suitcases. The bathroom was HUGE. The shower-head was HUGE it felt like my whole body was covered in wonderful warm water upon a longgggg day of sightseeing. Also, the bathrooms had TOWEL HEATERS. How much more meticulous than towel heaters can you get at this great price? Also, the bathroom had Versace tiles. So, for a snob like me, that's something I appreciate ;o) As for the SERVICE! There is this one guy named Roberto. He recommended FANTASTIC restaurants to us both nights AND made reservations for us (Alfredo's and De Buffetto Pizzaria). Also, at some point the TV wasn't working quite well so one of the other guys (who was working the night shift) popped right upstairs to help! EXCELLENT. Ok, so what's not so great? Ok well...the breakfast was decent, could be a bit better. However how can something so simple as a breakfast deter you from staying at this amazing establishment? Furthermore, almost all channels were in Italian, except BBC. If you're going to Rome to sit in a hotel room and watch tv, then you really should save your money and stay home! Keep in mind, I am very picky and have been to some great hotels but the Hotel Pantheon was fabulous. I was so happy with this experience and will definately stay here again in the future. By the way, everyone spoke very good English and we communicated quite well. 24 hr reception also. A+!!!!!! THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: jdecarlo
Reviews.Content: This is such a perfect place to stay, the location cannot be beat, the staff is phenomenal, the value was very good. The rooms are typical European, small, but perfectly clean, nice bathroom. Breakfast is included and is what we love, breads, meats, cheeses-the perfect start to the day. Theresa, Roberto and Ettore were so helpful with restaurant recommendations and directions, we really didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Those New to Rome”
Reviews.Author: alasuberdaplatz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to its location and the reviews on TA. For those who are new to Rome and intend to do the tourist bit I would advise staying at this hotel or ones near here. Everything you want to see & do is within walking distance. The room layout was very quirky, in fact the layout made it feel like a suite. We had little contact with the staff, but when we did they were very friendly and helpful. The only drawback to this hotel, and it is only a little one, is that the basement breakfast room felt claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good room, Great service”
Reviews.Author: CCB1232-0699
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located. We walked everyplace, from the Vatican to the train station, and most everything in between. Staff is great. My only small peeve is that there is only one English language TV station (BBC).

Reviews.Title: “Central location but not much else...”
Reviews.Author: ElaineS01
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Hotel Pantheon for one night after previously spending 5 nights in Sorrento and 4 nights in Rome before that staying at albergo cesari, rome. The location of the Hotel is definitely very central, only a few steps away from the Pantheon and maybe 5 minutes walk from Trevi fountain. However, the room, 102, was very very small. The bathroom was nice and modern but there was no space at all in the bedroom and it felt quite claustrophobic and dark. Overall, i think there are better places to stay for the same or better price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: JiveHoney
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 7 that stayed in the Hotel Pantheon for 2 nights. We have stayed in Rome before (Trastevere) so we used our knowledge from our previous stay to select the location. It absolutely lived up to expectation, perfect, right in the heart of the historic centre. We split our time into three different parts of Rome over the three days we were there, the colosseum and Palatine Hill to the south on day one, Vatican, St Peter's and all to West of river on day two, and Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza del Popolo and shops to East on day 3. When you've had enough of walking for one day, the area around the hotel is perfect for cafes and restaurants without having to go very far. As soon as you step out of the hotel you are straight into the lovely hustle and bustle of Rome at its best. The hotel was spotless, well decorated and well maintained and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms weren't hugebut perfectly adequate and we only had one good view of the front street from the three rooms we had, but this is a small boutique style hotel slap in the centre of Rome and the location was by far the overriding factor for us. Breakfast was usual continental affair and was fine. Would definately recommend and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TatevikD
Reviews.Content: You probably can't find a better location for your stay in Rome than the area close to Pantheon! My husband and I almost did not use any means of transportation for getting around Rome as the hotel was in a good distance from all major attractions. The hotel staff was incredibly nice, as well. When we have arrived at the hotel, it turned out that there was a problem with our credit card, which was declined because we did not have it any more, and had never informed the hotel about that. After our credit card was declined our room for the first night was given to someone else, however when we have arrived late in the evening, the hotel manager has called a taxi for us and transfered us to a different hotel, and next morning a taxi took us back to Hotel Pantheon, which has taken care of the taxi expenses. We were provided with a room even bigger than we had originally booked for, so all the inconvenience we had to suffer was compensated. The room we had on the second floor was very nice, with a nice bathroom with bathtub! The window was overlooking the street, so if we had left the windows open at night it would have been too noisy. The noise did not bother us much as it felt very nice and lively , however if you prefer very quite rooms than this might not be your hotel! The hotel offers a great service of transfers from and to airport for 55 euros in a luxurious car. On our way to Rome we took the fast train from Fiumincino airport to the Termini station, and from there we took a taxi to the hotel, this trip had cost us about 45 euros. So the pick-up service makes much more sense! And if you feel like having great coffee do drop by Tazza de'Oro cafe just across the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Paul017
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family (wife and two teenage duaghters) at the end of July 2010. We had one room at 200 Euros per night. Arrival and check-in were easy, and although they had only catered for three in the room on arrival, this was soon rectified whilst we went for a walk in the locale. The room was large and on the third floor, up in the eaves. This meant that we did not have much street noise, that others have commented on. The room was clean, although perhaps a little tired looking (in that the bed covers were fading from the overhead sky-lights. The hotel is compact, with a small lounge and bar area (which we didn't use as we had too much to do outside). The breakfast was OK. The hotel is in a great location, in fact I would suggest one of the best places to be for visiting Rome, with everything within easy walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to people who want to visit Rome and be in the heart of the town, i.e. not for anyone who wants to lounge in a hotel. I would also suggest asking for rooms at the top of the hotel, as we found them to be more than quite enough for a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westcumbria
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel. Great locatin just off the square, lots of great places to eat and shop. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is small and friendly with excellent rooms. I used Rome cabs for the transfers, who were very reliable. I want to go back and stay at the hotel. I had a wonderful time staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & staff”
Reviews.Author: bobd60067
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Hotel Pantheon last year (Jul 2009) while we were in Rome for a long family vacation. This hotel was GREAT on all counts... The location can not be beat. it is just down the street from the Pantheon (hence the hotel's name), literally at the end of the block. along this street are small shops and a good restaurant across the street. (and this is one of those classic narrow streets, so just about no traffic). it's walking distance from most of the Rome sites; we walked to Trevi, Spanish Steps, etc, and even Collesseum even though that was quite a hike. we took a bus to Vatican. the staff was fantastic. they were very helpful with maps, directions, fetching us a taxi, etc. and when we had a problem getting pictures off our camera for emailing to family/friends, they used their office computer to help us out! definitely what i'd call above and beyond. the room was nice and comfy with no issues here. pretty nice bath, too. all in all, we were exceptionally pleased with our stay here. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Would not hesitate to stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffymiller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Rome our last two nights in Italy. I had been in Italy for over three weeks and was ready to just find a "good value and a decent hotel" for those last couple of nights. Hotel Pantheon did not disappoint us. The hotel is located on a pedestrian street and is about a 30 second walk to the Pantheon square. I had previously stayed in the Spanish Steps area and found the Pantheon location to be much quieter and more charming (and less expensive!). There were excellent restaurants around this area too. We thoroughly enjoyed both a long lunch and dinner at Antonio's which was right across the street from Hotel Pantheon. We also enjoyed a meal at a nearby trattoria recommended in the NY Times. While the hotel is not a luxurious 5 star property, it IS an excellent value. It is an older boutique hotel with great Italian ambience. The lobby area had lovely wooden beamed ceilings with Venetian chandeliers, as did our room. Our room was very small, even by European standards. However, we had changed our reservation from four nights to two so we considered this acceptable. They also offered to move us the second night to a larger room. We did take a look at one of the larger rooms and it was more than adequate. The furniture could use some updating in the rooms we saw but the bathrooms were modernized and even had Versace tiling. There is a limited bar service for the lobby area (where we wanted to have a cocktail while watching part of the World Cup). You have to ask at the front desk to be served. Breakfast was included and a nice way to start the day. There was also a small store close by where you could purchase drinks and snacks. I will definitely return here but will make sure and get a larger room!

Reviews.Title: “super hotel at rome”
Reviews.Author: ritesh147
Reviews.Content: eligant hotel pantheon nice atmosphehere good facilities

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central location and SO Italian!”
Reviews.Author: sealwatcher
Reviews.Content: Stayed a long weekend in this beautiful hotel which was 2 secs from the Pantheon and close to all the sights-could walk from hotel to everywhere we wanted to visit. Breakfast was superb with a large choice and fantastic coffee. The rooms were spotless and sumptiously decorated. Staff gracious & helpful. Cannot recommend it enough. Booked take a taxi on-line to/from Airport 40 Euros one way-very promt and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “great location, some small annoyances”
Reviews.Author: bomania
Reviews.Content: Location cannot be beat, right outside the Pantheon, excellent restaurants. But it is LOUD. Nightlife was going on until about 3am, then the tour groups started noisily marching past at 8am. Around 2am I begged the night clerk to enable our air conditioner so we could close the window and have some white noise. After several minutes of pleading, he relented, but said this is a one-time extravagance. Not much sleep that first night, so we switched to a room in the back, and although there was no view, it was much quieter. I know I'm going to get teased for this, but for those of you who, like me, like to keep up with the news, the TVs in this hotel are complicated. Pick up remote A to turn on tv, put it down and pick up remote B to turn on digital tv thingy. Pick up remote A again to bring up channel list, use remote B to adjust volume. This was explained to us in Italian. They are also pretty stingy with Internet codes. I had to ask for a new code every day, and they refused to give me a code on the last day since we were checking out. I used one of my less-hostile-but-still-firm stares to eventually get the guy to loan us his personal code. Oh, and the beds are rock hard. We did have a great time overall, but probably would not book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute heaven!”
Reviews.Author: CheshireBexter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4 night break and came home engaged! The hotel is literally right next to the Pantheon and is in walking distance to all of the main attractions, the Trevi fountain, the Vatican etc. The room was divine and if I could have added an extra star to the sleep quality rating I would have. The bed was ridiculously comfortable! The bathroom was gorgeous and relaxing in a huge steaming bubble bath after walking all day was heavenly! The breakfast was lovely and set us up for a day's sightseeing. The staff were courteous, professional and very helpful but in no way overbearing. I put 5* for value but I know we got a very good deal on holiday rooms direct. The booking company went bust before we went but when we emailed the hotel they allowed us to keep the booking at the same price as we had booked through the booking company which was very good of them as at that point we our holiday was potentially ruined. If I ever go back to Rome I would stay here again as it was everything you could want and more.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Small Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrynMawrBK
Reviews.Content: My husband, 12-year-old daughter and I just returned from a very enjoyable stay at the Hotel Pantheon. Triple rooms can be expensive in Rome, so we were looking for a reasonably-priced but well-regarded hotel in a central location, and the Hotel Pantheon turned out to be a great choice. It's a block away from the Pantheon itself -- walk two doors down to the corner, and there it is -- so it is surrounded by decent restaurants, wine bars, shops and people-watching sites. Surprisingly, it wasn't noisy at night. We were upgraded to the "Diamante Suite", a great duplex suite with two full baths and three beds, plus plenty of room to stretch out.. Our dughter had her own private level so we had more privacy too. The staff in the hotel were truly exemplary. Roberto was extremely helpful and patient, and acted as bartender for us in the tiny, charming bar situated at the top of a spiral staircase leading up to a balcony overlooking the lobby. He also made phone calls for us from the front desk when our cell phones' international service wasn't cooperating. Hector was also very accommodating with anything we needed. Breakfast in the attractive basement dining room was varied and plentiful. We were sorry to have to leave and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TakesTrips
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pantheon: Great staff. Very friendly, professional, and helpful. The room was larger than I expected. Comfortable bed, and additional day bed. Flat screen tv, with BBC. Room could stand a bit of updating, though. Bathroom was roomy enough, new and modern, heated marble floor, heated towel rack, strong hot water in shower. Don’t expect a great view from the room. Rooms on street side face a building across the narrow street. One negative is the amount of street noise until early morning hours. I think that’s unavoidable given the amount of tourist traffic in the Pantheon area. Breakfast was ok. Breakfast room is pleasant. The gentleman overseeing was cordial as were all of staff, and made good, fresh-brewed coffee to your liking. Will also make scambled eggs, if you desire. Four kinds of cereal available, toast and jelly, good yogurt, sometimes fresh fruit, etc. However, croissants and coffee cake were stale, probably left over is my guess. Also, it’s not the fault of the hotel of course, but the food in this area is the worst I’ve ever had in my life, not to mention overpriced. Don’t expect Molto Mario. Why we travelers continue to participate in our own bilking is beyond me. My advice regarding eating in the Pantheon area: 1) If you have lots of money and don’t mind spending it, eat at one of the nicer restaurants and expect to pay way over $200 for a meal for two. 2) Eat at McDonald’s across the street from the Pantheon. 3) Eat take-out pizza by the slice, or grab a sandwich from a street vendor or one of the groceries or delis in the area. 4) Wait until you get home to have an authentic Italian meal, home-cooked or otherwise. Our experience on food included the following: --A charge of $9 to sit at a table and have a basket of bread which we did not request, --lasagna that was literally slop on a plate, --rubbery and tasteless gnocchi, --spaghetti with tiny, tiny shrimp and tough, chewy clams, all way too salty and fishy and obviously canned or frozen, with some kind of commercial flavoring added to the mix, --radicchio gratin, bitter and with no “gratin,” --artichokes, absolutely ruined. Hotel Pantheon is in a great central location in old Rome. Good walking distance from most everything. The area is filled with tourists, however, so expect this. Food is terrible. Musicians play cheesy music outside restaurants in the piazza. Also, don’t let a taxi driver charge you more than 40 euros for a trip to or from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “ok but not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: travellingwoman35
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect in January - I guess I wouldn't like to stay at this hotel in July or August because you are right in the middle of all the must-see-attractions. Therefore, of cause there are many tourists and a bit noise. The room was big, nice, clean and the bathroom very good. We had imagined a room with a view but none of the rooms have a view since the hotel lays in a building between two tall buildings - you look down a narrow street. Breakfast was ok, but nothing much - hard boilded (very hard boiled and cold!) eggs, cheese, bread, cake. Staff was polite and helpful. All in all: We had the room at a good price - 130 euro per night - and for that price it was a great hotel. But if we had payed the price from the hotel price list I wouldn't be satisfied. We have stayed at another hotel close to this (in the direction of Tiber) a year a go, it's called Hotel Ponte Sisto and it was in my oppinion more charming and you could get a room with a view (and a balcony) ...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sloopy1234
Reviews.Content: we booked Hotel Patheon about 3 months before our stay and got an amazing deal £79 per night including breakfast! we booked through the hotel itself. when we arrived at the hotel we were put for the first night into a large suite with two bathrooms and an upstairs area, it was stunning, the 2nd day we had a normal double room overlooking the street which obviously was smaller but also lovely , the bathrooms are very large and in very good condition, we cant wait to go back to this hotel again perhaps next January, the area the hotel is in is the best location as it is within walking distance of everything you want to see, i actually thought it might be quiet in January near the hotel but all the resturants were open until about midnight, and the bar two shops away from the hotel was open till 4am, (come out of the hotel and turn right) they did fantastic cocktails for 5 euros and shooters for 3 euros, be careful as two cocktails made me pretty merry as they free pour the measures! oh and they give you crisps or popcorn with your drink... as for food we ate a lot of pizza and pasta but must admit we would have liked something else but it seemed you either got a meal deal for 10-15 euros or else you had to eat in a very expensive place, we ate one night in a place near the vatacn city which was cheaper and nicer than the area around out hotel, the first day was very rainy but the hotel lent us a large umbrella and we had good clothes for the rain so we were fine , we visited the vatacan city on that day and found it good to look at in the rain! the rest of the time there was no rain and the last day was sunny so we took an open top tour bus for 10 euros each which took you around all the major sights for just over an hour (very well worth doing as you get to see things you may have missed and get to know what everything is, plus with so much walking it was nice to sit down) we went to Rome for 5 days but really could have done with 10 days or more as i think there were things we missed seeing but oh well we will just have to go back to see them! oh and there are great shops!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noise, smoke and smells kept us from sleeping all night.”
Reviews.Author: BeaucoupTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in mid-November 2009 when the temperatures during the day were 67-70 degrees and 46-50 degrees at night--perfect weather. We booked a triple room for the two of us at a rate of $217 (e 144.5). Our room was on the third floor (second floor in Italy) directly above the hotel entrance. The room had one large window with soundproof glass and shutters on the outside which you could open and close. (I made sure the hotel had soundproof windows before I booked (I have been to Rome before). When we checked in the room was very warm and stuffy so we opened the window and shutters. The fresh air was perfect however the deafening noise was not. The front of the hotel faces a narrow alley which has many, many restaurants and shops and is the main pathway to go to many of the sights in Rome so you have tour groups coming and going all the time. That was fine during the day because after all this is Rome. At night however the noise level increases with all the people eating and drinking at the restaurants which have tables and chairs sitting outside in the alley way. And, to make matters worse all the cooking smells come right up and into the room along with all the cigarette smoke from the diners. Also, the people who stay and work at the hotel and smoke, go outside and stand in front of the hotel to smoke and the smoke comes straight up and into the room. The restaurant noise goes until about 1:30 am and then they start to clean up and move all the tables and chairs inside scooting them along the cobblestones making a huge racket. The workers talk, smoke and listen to music while they are closing up. The noise finally stops around 3:30 AM. About 5 AM the street sweepers/garbage trucks/delivery trucks wake you and your day begins. We tried shutting the window at night but it was too hot and stuffy and we could not sleep. After the first night I went down to talk to the woman at the front desk to ask her how to turn on just the fan (I knew the heat or a/c would not be turned on during this part of the season). Even though there is a control for FAN, Speed 1,2, 3 and an On and Off switch, you cannot use the fan because it is only turned on during the specific periods in the summer when they turn on the a/c or the specific period in the winter when they turn on the heat. The bathroom was beautifully remodeled and housekeeping did a nice job. The gentleman who served the breakfast and the gentlemen who worked the front desk were very sweet, helpful and pleasant. I have been to Italy several times and each time for a month and have stayed at hotels and farm houses/villas in Florence, northern and southern Tuscany, Rome, Positano, and Capri. This is the only hotel I would not return to.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo, Hotel Pantheon!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelsinmyblood
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a post-cruise stay at Hotel Pantheon, and must say we were impressed with this small, hotel right in the middle of the best location in the Historic Center of Rome. Theresa, Roberto and Hector in Reception were wonderful, hospitable, and extremely helpful when advice on directions and restaurants were needed...We'd reserved the Triple Room with King and twin bed in what is supposed to be a very spacious room with large, state of the art bathroom...we,were pleasantly surprised to find we were upgraded to the 2 story suite which is identical to the photos on their website. The size was that of an apartment and the lovely ecclectic mix of antiques and traditonal furnishings and large screen tv made for a comfortable stay for the 3 of us. This unit holds 4 but an additional bed could be added to the master with no problem or discomfort. The bathrooms were gorgeous. HUGE with marble floors and tile ala Versace! Everything you could ask for..heated towel racks in both bathrooms, blow-dryers, huge tubs with plenty of hot water and large garden shower heads, large mirrors and bidets. And, of course the basket of lotions and shampoos were well stocked. The main bedroom has a mini-fridge and a large flat-screen tv. The rooms have an old-world ambiance with beamed, sloped ceilings and tile. The breakfast was well-done and scrambled eggs with bacon could be requested if one desires. There was an ample array of fresh fruit, juices, coffe and tea, meats, cheeses, fruit tarts and fresh baked goods, along with cereal and oatmeal, and hard-boiled eggs and yogurt. The server was more than happy to accomodate when I asked for a latte... All in all, this place is a gem, and the location is incredible...just a one-minute walk to the majestic Pantheon, and 5-8 minute walk to Trevi, and less than 5 minutes to Piazza Navona. We even walked to the Colloseum and the Forum and Palatine Hill, which took no more than 15 minutes...In addition, a wonderful gelateria, restaurants and supermarket and pharmacy and little shops are all on the same block or in the Piazza near the Pantheon...I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to make the most of their time in Rome. And remember, learn a few pleasantries in the native language..it goes a long way. You will have the most amazing time abroad if you leave your complaint notebook at home and immerse yourself in the culture rather than try to compare it with the U.S. If you're tough to please and very critical, I doubt you would enjoy yourself fully no matter where you are...so go with the flow and enjoy yourself, you never know if you will pass this way again...

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Staff - "EXCEPTIONAL"”
Reviews.Author: Marbleheader18
Reviews.Content: Thank you Teresa, Raffaele and Mareo for making our trip to Rome a memorable one. We will re-visit and totally recommend your hotel to friends. Located in the heart of Rome, you couldn't ask for a better place to stay. The Staff is terrific!!! This hotel is in walking distance to many of the attractions. This was my first trip to Rome, but have travelled many places in Europe. The staff can make or break a hotel visit. They made our trip to Rome, one we will all remember and one that makes us want to come back and visit again. We took their recommendations on restaurants for both nights and had wonderful meals and great times at both. I will not mention our restaurants, you'll have to visit and ask them for yourselves. We miss you guys. Thanks again........ Paige Marblehead, Massachusetts

Reviews.Title: “pantheon rome”
Reviews.Author: ranger2810
Reviews.Content: hotel pantheon is in a fantastic central location. as soon as we arrived we were treated well by the very helpful service from reception,porter and breakfast staff.all rooms are spacious with all u will need. i would definately recommend this hotel to anybody

Reviews.Title: “This unassuming hotel lived up to its historic name a place fit even for the Roman Gods”
Reviews.Author: travellinpaidi
Reviews.Content: We arrived late into Rome and were tired and sweaty but the friendly staff greeted us and really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. In fact they even advised us of all the excellent italian places to eat, that dont charge you tourist prices. As we are lazy travellers the reception staff never minded us asking on average 10 times a day for directions and even provided us with bus numbers. The rooms were luxiourous and very comfortable and it was lovely to arrive into a room with aircondition on for a while. We were also grateful of the abundance of breakfast goods available in the morning. The hotel is also located in the the centre of everything

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: love2goniceplaces
Reviews.Content: Great central location just round the corner from the Pantheon. Could walk to everywhere- Trevi fountain, Spanish steps, Piazza Novona all less than 10 mins. We walked to Colosseum too. Friendly, helpful staff- organised airport transport. Even though the room was small, it was very comfortable with air conditioning and fridge- a must at this time of year! Quaint breakfast room with adequate breakfast. Would definitely stay here again. Fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Kiwichick49
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Rome. Last time we stayed in St Peters Square.This time we decided to stay in the middle. The Pantheon Hotel is so central to all major sites so you can walk in any direction and you will come across some spectacular buildings.Including the beautiful Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon.The Hotel has many wonderful restaurants close by and, the shopping(if you can afford it ,is great) also close.We found the staff very polite and helpful.Our room was comfortable and clean(loved the bathroom) At 1st it may seem a bit noisey but,once you close the windows,you hear vertually nothing.After all,you are in central Rome.Go on book it,you are worth it ,and will not regret your decision.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: baztipp
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this hotel. Found the staff very friendly and helpful and the hotel clean with all the services your require. Great location in the middle of Rome which allowed us to walk everywhere .

Reviews.Title: “Roman home”
Reviews.Author: dimoc
Reviews.Content: the Pantheon hotel is in a peaceful and privileged location (The pantheon is 1feet by walk), just a couple of minutes walk from the trevi fountain and navona square In the small street where you can find a lot of tratorie, yummy gelati, pizzerie, bars and bicycle rentals. the hotel is like a roman home nice room, lobby and internet point!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: airUk
Reviews.Content: Have just spent a really fantastic few days at the hotel pantheon. Staff were all very nice and very helpful. Had booked a double room and was very happy to be given a suite on the top floor,huge room very clean. location of the hotel is perfect for all the sights, a very easy walk to all the main sights. The lady on the reception was so nice and helpful and was always full of ideas for places to go. This hotel is well worth a visit. One last point ,went to the restaurant IL BARROCCIO which is just down from the hotel for a meal on the first night BIG MISTAKE service was so bad,so slow we almost gave up and left [ i wish we had] the staff were so rude and did not want to know. The food ok nothing to write home about,and to top the lot when the bill came they they had over charged us by a lot. Do not eat here there are many better places to eat in rome. Restaurant ACQUISTO which is right turn out of the hotel keep going until you get to the piazza di pietra its at the far end,food and service very good,fantastic wine list.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Roma”
Reviews.Author: JanetQueensland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from Australia and stayed for four nights at this hotel at the beginning of a guided tour through the southern part of Italy and then one more night at the end of our month long trip. We found the staff at fron desk obliging, helpful and well spoken in English. The room - Diamond suite was large with an upstairs but old bathroom, then we stayed in another room on 1st floor which had a Versace bathroom and very warm cosy feel to the room overlooking the front entrance. This was a little noisy as there is a nightclub across the road but the whole hotel is so centrally located we loved it. The front concierge Hector arranged for a tour of Vatican city for us and taxi from airport with minimum of fuss. We enjoyed our stay very much and would recommend it to anyone. Great coffee shop across the road from the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the first floor like the plague!!”
Reviews.Author: RosieWestonFavell
Reviews.Content: We - two ladies in our sixties - stayed in rooms on the first floor. Room 105 is small, dingy and opens on to a brick wall; the bathroom was much nicer than the bedroom. Room 102 is bigger, overlooks the narrow street which is packed with restaurants and is very noisy until about 1 a.m. Then from 5 a.m. the noise starts up again with dust carts etc. However, the staff were very friendly and efficient, the breakfast good, the bathrooms excellent and the LOCATION FANTASTIC. You can walk to all the main sights, there are plenty of affordable trattoria and pizzeria within a stone's throw. If you book on a high floor, or splash out on a top grade top floor room, you'll be fine. But avoid Room 102 LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: angie26
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure the hotel staff were helpful and polite. It was my parent's Golden Wedding present - the staff did not know this. All staff - breakfast room (Ruby et al), the staff in reception, cleaners and the porters were very friendly. The breakfast was very good. A central hotel, perhaps a little expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: heviseeper
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of Rome hotels and know it can be expensive, but this is by far the worst hotel I have been to in the city. I cant tell you how bad it is. Dirty, dingey, cramped and most bathroom fittings were broken. A really disappointing end to our week in Italy. It may be central but thats it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: PhilThomas
Reviews.Content: Although slightly expensive this Hotel is well worth any extra paid (we saved the extra paid in not having any transport costs once there as the hotel is right in the centre of all the sights) Ideally situated just off the Pantheon Square, it is in easy walking distance of all the main sights in Rome easily, and is clean, romantic and the Reception staff are amazingly helpful. Spend some time with them to find restuarants and the best way to see this wonderful city at its best.Can not rate this hotel highly enough. One small complaint was that our room did not have any cupboard or drawer space.

Reviews.Title: “OK.......BUT!”
Reviews.Author: LondonRocket
Reviews.Content: We originally booked an apartment for a week in Rome and were very disappointed to find on arrival that it was depressing and dirty and very unlike the write-up on the web. Unable to bear more than a night at the apartment we decamped to The Pantheon Hotel. We had Room 101 at 200 euros a night and found it to be very small and dark, rather miserably decorated in hues of brown and yellow and with a well-worn carpet. It was, though, extremely clean. The bathroom was large by comparison and had a great shower. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful at all times, and the breakfast was nice. The hotel is absolutely ideally situated for walking to almost all the historical sites and museums. Our main problem was the almost unrelenting noise - the room is on the first floor overlooking the street where there are several restaurants, shops, etc. The noise of people talking, laughing and shouting was constant and went on well into the night and on two occasions until 4 in the morning. When we did finally get to sleep the noise would start again with the refuse collection and street cleaning vehicles roaring slowly up and down, and the staff in the restaurants dragging chairs and tables around endlessly. The building is in a very narrow street and with tall buildings on either side, so the noise is contained. However, even though it was impossible to have the window open because of the noise, the air-conditioning was very efficient. I am not saying the Pantheon is not a good hotel in many ways - but do avoid room 101 or any on the first floor overlooking the street if you value some peace!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: jlsjls87
Reviews.Content: I researched hotels for hours before deciding to book the Hotel Pantheon. The hotel staff arranged for a taxi to pick us up at the airport and take us directly to the hotel. Close to the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain, we had fun exploring the area. We stayed in the Diamante Suite which is a two level room with two bathrooms. The bathrooms are great. It was perfect for us and our three children. Only two negatives - the carpet in the room definitely needs to be replaced. It's quite dirty. Another improvement would be to add some lighting. The room is kind of dark. The breakfast was nice. On this trip we also visited Venice where we stayed in a two bedroom/two bathroom apartment (modern and clean). The price in Venice was half the price of the Hotel Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “OK, good location”
Reviews.Author: mbiz
