Reviews.Content: Mixed opinion on this one. Location is great for tourism, 100m away from the Pantheon. Not easy to reach by cab and a bit loud, with things going on 24 hours a day. Reception is friendly, but distracted. Room was small - the size of my queen bed - and a bit stuffy, with the TV placed in an akward corner, but the somewhat strangely laid-out smallish bathroom was comfortable, with an oversize bath tub and good amenities. Breakfast could be upgraded for the price. Wifi never got to work in my room, but did work in lobby, with cards at Euro 3 per 60 minutes of usage. Rates vary and in season are too high for what is offered. But that goes for much of Rome...

Reviews.Title: “So close to The Pantheon....”
Reviews.Author: CCAM1
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 4 nights at the Hotel Pantheon which is situated literally steps away from the wonderful Pantheon and what we thought to be one of the best squares in Rome. We booked via the Hotel's website and this was very straightforward. The staff were mostly very helpful and friendly both before and during our stay. They recommended restaurants and made telephone reservations for us. Continental Breakfast was good, although it was always the same every day - not so good if staying more than a few days. Our bedroom (202) overlooked the small road and, like a lot of City Hotels, was VERY NOISY. We asked to change to a quieter room perhaps to the back of the Hotel but we were told there were noise problems there with aircon plant. We investigated and there were. One of us remembered the ear plugs, the other had to go to buy a pair. Problem solved! Otherwise, the room was comfortable. This Hotel is not the best but is good and is in a wonderful location. Very easy to walk to the Vatican City, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona. We will definitely stay there again when we next visit this beautiful City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at the Hotel Pantheon”
Reviews.Author: emileee
Reviews.Content: Due to a booking problem we were switched from the hotel that we booked in Rome to the Hotel Pantheon. Lucky us! This is in a great location just steps away from the Pantheon and within walking distance of the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and so many other great spots. In addition to the super location we enjoyed a clean larger than expected room with great amenities. Thanks to Paulo and staff for their attentive and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bislett
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an absolutely perfect location very close to the Pantheon. The hotel is small and very charming. We booked the hotel via travel agent but got in touch directly with the hotel through email. They replied quickly and offered taxi service from the airport which we accepted. The price was 60 Euro. Their email is: --- Arriving we got a very nice room (104). Very cosy and quite spacious considering this a hotel in Roma city center. Bathrom was well equipped and large with bath tube too. Cleaning was very good. The room had window towards a back yard so the view is nothing to write about but on the other hand it was very silent and we had no problems whatsoever with noise at night. Considering it is in the middle of Roma this was quite amazing. Staff was helpful and friendly and also got us taxi service for the departure day. I would recommend the taxi service since it can be hard to find the hotel on your own if you don'tknow exactly where it is. Walking distance to many famous places in Rome, Forum, Capitol, Fontana di Trevi,Piazza Navona, the Vatican. This hotel is surely a gem and we will definately stay here the next time we are on Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: tion95
Reviews.Content: I'm sure in peak season this is a pricey place to stay, but last minute rates were great! The staff was very helpful and the breakfast superb. Although the room wasn't huge it was more comfortable than other places we stayed in Rome. Would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Simmonscourt
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights at the end of November 2005 - the location won't be beaten, it's right in the centre of all the main visitor attractions and surrounded by bars and restaurants. The staff were very courteous and attentive to our every need. The room (Room 104) though not a big room was very nicely decorated, very clean, comfortable and pleasant. We paid EUR170.00 per night for a twin room (booked on laterooms.com)which was acceptable to me given its location, the courtesy of the staff and this included continental breakfast. I would recommend this hotel and would stay in it again. Seán Dublin, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended, Why? . . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Converted from an old building with high ceilings, the hotel is clean, nicely decorated and perfectly functional. What makes it great is the location, literally 20 metres away from the Pantheon, surrounded by sights and restaurants - try the Ristorante da Fortunato, 20 metres down an alley opposite the Pantheon, Mid-priced, but a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: maruczka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pantheon Hotel for my first trip solo (middle-aged woman)for three or four nights in May. The location was perfect, as stated by many before me. The breakfasts were very good and the staff in the breakfast room were delightful and welcoming. Unfortunately a young man on the desk during the weekend was extremely rude and unhelpful. Otherwise the staff on the desk were very pleasant. I had the unfortunate experience of water pouring onto my bed from the room upstairs (twice) so was relocated. No financial compensation was offered. I checked the Albergo del Senato right on the piazza and for the same price would have had much nicer accommodation. I will stay there for my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “best location for the pantheon in the area”
Reviews.Author: huggies79
Reviews.Content: This is THE best hotel location and our room was great. We paid 180 euro and couldn't fault anything about the hotel. The only hotel we'd stayed at that actually provided a lovely big bath and fluffy bath robes! All our other choices had showers. TV choices were poor ...all italian, and no internet access, but an internet cafe directly opposite the hotel meant that wasn't a problem. The breakfast was the best we've had on our travels around Italy this June, and the little trattoria, Antonio's right opposite the hotel is the best you'll find in Rome. Very small, but a wonderful ambience and splendid food, amazingly we'd discovered this place ten years ago, and wondered if it was still there. To find it right opposite the Pantheon hotel just made our stay. A room overlooking the street as we'd requested, proved to be noisy until about midnight, as it's in a narrow street with buildings on each side therefore, no escape for the noise. However, that's what we like, the sounds of Rome just outside the window is what makes the holiday for us, but not to everyone's taste I would imagine.

Reviews.Title: “I will come back soon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really nice and clean, with a very helpfull staff. I will come back soon. Don't miss this place

Reviews.Title: “Euro 190.00 broom closet with shoddy service”
Reviews.Author: dburstyn
Reviews.Content: Euro 190.00 bought me a broom closet of a room (# 204) from the door one fell immediately into bed, the TV was hanging from one corner, there was a triangular shelf in one of the corners, serving as a desk - if only one could have pulled out the chair enough to sit in it. The bathroom door opened 1/4 of an inch from the sink. The safe did not work. The room was dark, even on the brightest sunny Rome day - electric light did not make it much better, since every second light bulb was missing. Service equally bad, on a rainy day asked the doorman to get me a taxi and was advised that when it rains in Rome he needs 25 minutes for a free line - why don't I go out and wait in the rain for a taxi. Second day of my stay, the hotel started renos , at 7 o'clock in the morning the hammering started. All paint cans, terpentine, etc. was then stored in the lobby - made for an elegant look. Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem: location is fantastic, room is the nicest I' ve got in my life, buffet breakfast is delicious, staff is really helpful and polite... can't wait to go back...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. It was a bit overpriced for the room we got (make sure that you request a room with a street-view), but the rooms were exceptional, the staff was very pleasant. The real draw for us to stay here was the location. You are really just 100 yards from the Pantheon piazza and the Pantheon itself. It seems that whatever direction you decide to stroll, you are close to it all: The old ruins/Colosseum area, the Piazza Nuova, the Trevi Fountain, etc. Lots of great attractions are all just a short stroll away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!Perfect!Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This property is one of the best charming hotel in town. The rooms are nice and really clean. Location couldn't be better. Magnificent breakfast and professional staff. I' d wish to be there while I am writing this review! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: PBrave
Reviews.Content: Charming European-style hotel. Wonderful and helpful service. Location an A plus - right in the center of Rome. Accommodations are comfortable, though not luxurious. Diamante Suite is perfect for a family, though be careful in hot weather.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous small hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Gubbini
Reviews.Content: If you want a great location in Rome in a small, personal hotel, this is the place to stay. Our family stayed here for four nights and everyone loved it. The rooms were very interestingly appointed and clean. My mother's room even had a little staircase leading up to her bedroom. Bathrooms were nice-sized and very functional. Breakfast was in a pleasant, beautifully furnished room on the lower level and included a nice array of cereal, breads, yogurts, fruits, cheeses and meats. Everyone on the staff that we met was friendly and helpful. English was not a problem, but the staff were also quite kind when we wanted to try our Italian language skills. They arranged for a car to pick us up at the airport and were very responsive to our concerns about air conditioning (not working one day). Location is perfect - steps away from the Pantheon, across from one of the best coffee places in Rome (Tazza d'oro) and a 2 minute walk from one of the best gelateria in Italy (Gioletti). It is also a very short walk from Piazza Navona and a 5 minute walk from Piazza Venezia where you can access numerous city bus routes. If you prefer to walk, you can easily walk from the hotel to the Colosseum, Roman Forum, Spanish Steps, Castel Sant'Angelo, Vatican and many museums.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: emmi331
Reviews.Content: I loved this little hotel's location! You could walk to any of the main attractions of Rome within minutes.My room was barely large enough to turn around in, but comfortable - and it had a marble bathroom that was almost as big as the room! The staff is very friendly and helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Pantheon
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Pastini 131, 00186 Rome, Italy
